title: COVID hospitalizations at least 3 times higher among seniors than other age groups
description: New CDC data shows COVID-19 hospitalizations among Americans aged 70 and older are at least three times higher than among other age groups.

title: Jay Leno opens up about his accident: 'It was an accident, that's all'
description: Jay Leno is opening up about the accident he had in his home garage last month.

title: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass declares homelessness an emergency
description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass has declared homelessness an emergency in the California city.

title: Breonna Taylor's boyfriend settles lawsuits over shooting
description: Breonna Taylor's boyfriend has settled two lawsuits against the city of Louisville

title: Man gets 14 months in prison for his role in US Capitol riot
description: A Massachusetts man has been sentenced to 14 months in prison on charges of assaulting, resisting or impeding police officers during the January 2021 riot at the U.S. Capitol

title: Manchin has 'no intention' of switching to be independent, suggests that could change
description: Joe Manchin on Monday left the door open to becoming an independent, three days after Arizona colleague Kyrsten Sinema announced that she was leaving the Democratic Party

title: Ukraine PM requests air defenses to counter Russia attacks
description: Ukraine’s prime minister is appealing for Patriot missile batteries and other high-tech air defense systems to counter Russian attacks that have knocked out electricity and water supplies for millions of Ukrainians

title: CVS, Walgreens finalize $10B in settlements over opioids
description: CVS and Walgreens have finalized more than $10 billion in settlements of lawsuits nationwide over the toll of the opioids their pharmacies sold

title: Idaho murders: Police 'have a lot of information' they're not releasing
description: As police investigate the University of Idaho murders, an "army of analysts" are combing through the videos submitted to the FBI tip line.

title: Florida COVID data critic reaches agreement on felony charge
description: A fired Florida health data manager who accused officials of wanting to manipulate COVID-19 statistics has reached an agreement with prosecutors on a felony charge that she illegally accessed state computers

title: WATCH:  Kitten doesn't approve of Christmas tree with umbrella base
description: Curious kitten Ash is not a fan of this Christmas tree that "snows" into its base.

title: Soccer journalist Grant Wahl's body returned to US
description: A senior State Department official says the body and possessions of soccer journalist Grant Wahl have been repatriated to the United States after his death last week while covering the World Cup in Qatar

title: WATCH:  Zoo welcomes Malayan tapir calf
description: England’s Chester Zoo welcomed a rare Malayan tapir calf called Nessa. The birth is special because the zoo said there are only 2,500 Malayan tapirs in the world.

title: WATCH:  Illinois middle schooler hits game-winning full-court shot
description: A basketball court erupted in cheers and screams after an eighth grade student in Illinois made a bold, nearly full-court shot at the buzzer to clinch the win.

title: BLM sets up student relief fund as loan forgiveness stalls
description: The Black Lives Matter Global Network Foundation has launched a new relief fund aimed at Black college students, alumni and dropouts overburdened by mounting education costs and the student loan debt crisis

title: Megan Thee Stallion set to testify Tuesday on alleged shooting in Tory Lanez trial
description: Supporters of Megan Thee Stallion are set to rally outside a courtroom in Los Angeles as the she prepares to testify about the in the trial of rapper Tory Lanez.

title: Judge rejects vaccine choice law in health care settings
description: A federal judge says a person's choice to decline vaccinations does not outweigh public health and safety requirements in medical settings

title: Pelé's health improves, but he remains in hospital
description: Brazilian soccer great Pelé is doing better after having been hospitalized to treat a respiratory infection aggravated by COVID-19

title: 77-year-old woman stabbed to death at her home during car robbery
description: Eleanor Bowles, 77, interrupted the suspect's robbery of her 2021 Lexus before she was fatally stabbed, Atlanta police said.

title: Texas coach Beard arrested on felony family violence charge
description: Texas men’s basketball coach Chris Beard has been arrested on a felony family violence charge

title: Winter storm slams Northeast, 90 flights canceled across US: Latest forecast
description: Ninety flights are canceled across the country on Monday, including 36 in Boston, as winter storms wreak havoc on roadways.

title: Taliban: Assailants attack hotel in Afghan capital Kabul
description: A Taliban official says a hotel catering to foreign visitors in Afghanistan’s capital of Kabul was attacked and three of the assailants were killed

title: Europe shifts focus to avoiding energy shortage next year
description: The heads of the International Energy Agency and European Union’s executive branch say the 27-nation bloc is expected to weather an energy crisis this winter

title: Crews find 4th victim from blast at San Antonio company
description: Crews have found the body of a fourth person who died in an explosion at a San Antonio construction company and investigators are working to determine the cause and origin of the blast

title: 2 Australia police, bystander killed in ambush in rural area
description: Two Australian police officers and a bystander have been fatally shot in an ambush at a remote property in Queensland state as officers were investigating reports of a missing person

title: 3 children die after fall into icy lake; UK gripped by storm
description: There are severe weather warnings for large parts of the United Kingdom.

title: Twitter relaunching subscriber service after debacle
description: A previous attempt failed.

title: Keystone Pipeline oil spill investigators search for cause of Kansas rupture
description: Officials worked over the weekend to mitigate the fallout from the Keystone Pipeline rupture that leaked about 14,000 barrels of crude oil into a Kansas creek.

title: Dogs gifted by North's Kim resettle in South Korean zoo
description: A pair of dogs gifted by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un four years ago have ended up at a zoo in South Korea following a dispute over who should foot the bill for the animals' care

title: 2nd Oath Keepers Jan. 6 sedition trial to get underway
description: Opening statements are expected Monday in the second seditious conspiracy trial against members of the far-right Oath Keepers group charged in the Capitol attack on Jan. 6, 2021

title: Missouri man seeks exoneration in murder; 2 others confessed
description: A hearing begins Monday in a case that will decide if the conviction should be overturned for a Missouri man who has spent nearly three decades in prison for a murder that two other people have since confessed to committing

title: Second Iranian detainee executed over alleged protest crime
description: Iran says it executed its second prisoner detained amid the nationwide protests now challenging the country’s theocracy
